overview_description: R is a free, open-source programming language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. It's a GNU project similar to the S language, designed around a true computer language that allows users to add additional functionality by defining new functions. R is widely used for data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization. Created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman, R provides comprehensive statistical analysis capabilities with extensive package ecosystem through CRAN (Comprehensive R Archive Network). The language excels at data manipulation, statistical modeling, and creating publication-quality graphics.

R provides powerful built-in graphics capabilities through base R plotting functions
Enhanced by packages like ggplot2 for grammar of graphics, plotly for interactive visualizations
Specialized packages for specific chart types
Comprehensive statistical graphics, publication-ready plots, and advanced visualization techniques
